column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Would you say it comes from emotion and character ?
#Text=Yeah -- how well you can convey to the audience your point of view .
#Text=You could be living in a box , but if you can really convey it well then it makes for exciting reading .
#Text=But , you know , you have to be Proust to do that .
#Text=Do you draw any inspiration from the current political climate , either in the country or in the world ?
#Text=Politically , I 'm an activist , but my work is always about sort of the attitude that underlies it all .
#Text=I rarely deal with topical stuff .
#Text=It feels topical , but it is n't .
#Text=I mean , Talk Radio kind of surprised people , because they revived it last year , twenty years after it had been written , and it felt fresh .
#Text=But that 's because I do n't really write about topical stuff ; I write about American attitudes , American values , my values , my attitudes .
#Text=And to the degree that anybody sees things the way I see things , they can relate .
#Text=But I 'm not going to set out and say , " Okay , now what can I write about George Bush today ? "
#Text=I just think there 's enough people writing blogs about that .
#Text=Do you think narrative is one of the more challenging aspects of writing ?
#Text=Telling a good story is a dying art .
#Text=Not just in fiction , but in book writing , where you 're given a little bit of a leeway because it 's the nature of fiction ; you can meander a little bit .
#Text=But in films and in plays , it 's hard to know how to tell a good story .
#Text=It 's sort of one those basic things you have to know how to do before you even sit down to write .
#Text=You 're juggling a lot of balls if you want to a good literary writer .
#Text=Obviously , you have to have control of the prose itself , the rhetoric of the whole thing , the way you put it forth .
#Text=Then there 's the storytelling .
#Text=Then it 's like who cares that you have something to say unless you have a good reason to say it ?
#Text=Do you ever ask yourself that question about your writing ?
#Text=Like a lot of artists , I started out with a particularly strong point of view , coming from where I was coming from , wherever that might be .
#Text=Like a suburban kid moving into the city or whatever you want to say I was twenty years ago .

#Text=But I became successful , and then I found it more and more interesting to write about those things that are part of my successful life , which actually are less and less interesting for an audience to read about .
#Text=So I mean --
#Text=you know what I 'm saying ?
